projects.title: North Cascades National Park
projects.intro: Modernize how the public accesses a beloved national park’s backcountry.
projects.description:
Modernized and improved internal and visitor-facing backcountry permitting processes, ranger station visitor flows, and internal and public-facing web-based tools.

More details coming soon.
projects.roles: Web and desktop front end development, UX and UI design, enclosure design, Linux system administration, project management
projects.colophon: jQuery, MySQL, Python, PHP, C#/.NET, WPF, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe InDesign

projects.title: Oculus AR/VR Research
projects.intro: Invent new ways for humans to interact with their physical and digital worlds.
projects.description:
Defined, prototyped, and tested new multi-modal interactions and experiences for the future of virtual reality and augmented reality. Prototypes and demos were critical for senior executive leadership to evaluate the potential of radically new input/output paradigms.

More details coming soon.
projects.roles: Hardware and AR/VR prototyping, executive demo development, interaction design
projects.colophon: Unity 3D (C#), Unreal Engine (BluePrints), Oculus Rift, Microsoft Hololens, Arduino, Raspberry Pi, Node.js, Vue.js, socket messaging

links.title: Inventing the Future by Michael Abrash, Chief Scientist at Oculus Research

projects.title: Microsoft Hacking STEM Education
projects.intro: Empower students and educators to visualize and analyze their world in Excel.
projects.description:
Executed a major code migration and UI redesign for the Microsoft Excel Data Streamer add-in utilized by STEM educators and hobbyists to display real-time data from Arduino-based microcontrollers in Excel.

Migrated an existing Visual Basic prototype to a production-ready, shippable C# product. Oversaw the UX/UI design track to prepare the add-in for wider release.

Further supported, built and prototyped Arduino-based projects targeted toward middle school students.
projects.roles: C#/.NET development, UX design, Arduino/electronics prototyping
projects.colophon: C#/.NET, Visual Studio, Arduino, Serial/COM control, Visual Studio Tools for Office (VSTO)

projects.title: Amazon Go Store
projects.intro: Simulate, design, and test a checkout-free grocery store before it’s technically possible.
projects.description:
Critical member of the product design team working to create Amazon's revolutionary, completely checkout-free retail shopping experience centered around the vision of “Just Walk Out”. Directed the prototyping and “Wizard of Oz” simulation efforts and proved them to be invaluable media for design exploration and building realistic, testable experiences that weren't yet technically possible. These simulations and prototypes were used by the design team and executive leadership to (in)validate experiences throughout the store's development.

Utilized an eclectic array of technologies to iteratively build and simulate these experiences, including: Wii Remotes, lighting controls, socket communication servers, and scores of Android tablets and phones running custom Cordova apps.
projects.roles: Prototyping and usability testing direction, motion design direction, executive leadership presentations
projects.colophon: Cordova, TypeScript, AngularJS, Node.js, JavaScript, HTML5/CSS3

projects.title: Microsoft Band
projects.intro: Empower designers to quickly design and test end-to-end experiences.
projects.description: Part of a small, start-up minded product design team. Collaborated with UX and UI designers on design and implementation of visual and UI flow explorations for the Microsoft Band. Developed rapid UX prototypes and a high fidelity, end-to-end touchscreen prototype which was critical for formal usability testing and presentations to executive leadership before the hardware was capable of displaying the UI.
projects.roles: UX and research prototyping, brainstorming, motion/design integration

projects.title: Microsoft Connected Car
projects.intro: Build research environments, platforms, and prototypes to help design safer ways for drivers to stay connected.
projects.description:
• Assisted UX and UI designers in brainstorming and rapidly prototyping design explorations and research hypotheses for next generation, in-car infotainment systems.
  • Managed the build out of a life-size simulation and testing environment which featured prototype communciation with a real Ford steering wheel and controls.
  • Added statistical analytics to prototypes that were critical in enabling user researchers to analyze quantitative data after studies.
projects.roles: UX and research prototyping, brainstorming, driving simulator management

projects.title: Vulcan Interactive Street Art
projects.intro: Puzzle passers by with a fun interactive experience in Seattle’s budding South Lake Union.
projects.description:
Part of a large-scale effort by Paul Allen’s Vulcan to revitalize the South Lake Union neighborhood, this outdoor installation bridges the gap between interactive and art. Passers by are given the opportunity to capture and add their own likeliness to the piece.

Similar to the Scream Booth, it features a touchscreen UI with webcam preview to aid visitors in aligning their faces in the frame before capturing their image with a DSLR. The image is then processed, sliced up and animated across 5 displays adjacent to the capture station.

A custom capturing tool was built using .NET and C# to control the Canon DSLR. Communication between the capture station, capture tool and passive displays was all managed via socket messaging.
projects.roles: Lead developer and technologist, ideation, brainstorming
projects.colophon: Flash, AIR, ActionScript 3, Pixel Bender, .NET/C#, Canon ED-SDK

projects.title: MoPOP Scream Booth Exhibit
projects.intro: Capture the essence of terror and villainy then share it with the world.
projects.description:
Visitors to the EMP’s Can’t Look Away horror exhibit can capture their terror or villainy in the extremely popular Scream Booth. After scanning their soul for fear, the interactive assigns a role (victim or villain), provides scream inspiration, then captures a succession of 4 photos via DSLR. Screamers’ photos are then displayed outside the booth for all to see. Additionally, they can opt into sharing them on Flickr and receiving an email from a Constant Contact email campaign.

DSLR capturing was controlled with a custom-built capturing tool utilizing the official Canon ED-SDK in .NET. Communication between the capture station, capture tool and passive displays was all managed via socket messaging.
projects.colophon: Flash, AIR, ActionScript 3, .NET/C#, Flickr API, Constant Contact API, Canon ED-SDK

projects.title: MoPOP Nirvana Confessional Exhibit
projects.intro: Give the power of personal story telling to Nirvana fans at Seattle’s coolest museum.
projects.description:
Visitors to the MoPOP’s highly anticipated Nirvana: Taking Punk to the Masses exhibition can share their 90-second Nirvana "confessional" in a private booth featuring a touch screen interface and HD webcam. Upon submission, it is projected just outside the booth alongside other confessions and rare Nirvana footage in a mini-theater setting.

Built the recording interface and functionality while hiring and managing a subcontractor to build the theater playback interface. Recording was done using an HD capable USB webcam in Adobe’s Flash Media Live Encoder via the native process API in Adobe AIR. Communication between recording and playback machines was managed with socket messaging.
projects.roles: Development lead, kiosk configuration, subcontractor management
projects.colophon: Flex 4, AIR, Cairngorm, HD video capture, .NET/C#

projects.title: Kodak Photo Effects
projects.intro: Simulate and test in-camera photo effects.
projects.description: Developed a touch-based photo effects prototype UI for usability and market research purposes for a leading US digital camera company. Flex and Adobe AIR proved the perfect fit for the task of quickly crafting a standalone UI while easily integrating with Adobe’s powerful Pixel Bender real-time effects engine.
projects.roles: UI development, effects R&D, design integration

projects.title: Nintendo Wii API Design
projects.intro: Provide official content partners an elegant API for streaming video on the Wii gaming console.
projects.description: First utilized by the BBC for their popular iPlayer, the Video On-Demand Framework (VODF) Flash Lite API enables official partners to build Wii Channels using ActionScript 2 and Flash. Utmost attention was paid to class simplicity and extensibility, including building a robust, AS3 inspired event model. All source was meticulously documented and beautifully formatted.
projects.roles: Lead API design and development, formal documentation

projects.title: Kodak EasyShare-One Interface
projects.description: Brought my Flash expertise to a group of Java/C++ engineers in building a Flash UI for the highly anticipated consumer touch screen camera.
projects.roles: Design integration and optimization, performance testing and optimization, build management, localization management

projects.title: Battle Monument Exhibit Platform
projects.client: American Battle Monuments Commission / Normandy Cemetary
projects.intro: Architect a robust kiosk platform to scale to over 44 unique battle monuments throughout the world.
projects.description:
The World War II timeline kiosk gives visitors to the American cemetery and war memorial in Normandy, France a chance to truly see the world scope and impact of the second great war.

The code base was built as a fully localizable and skinnable system to be reused for other battle monuments throughout the world. It has since been used to build 11 new memorial experiences.
projects.colophon: Flex 4, Spark skinning, localization, RobotLegs, AIR, ActionScript 3

projects.title: NASA Fur Seals Interactive
projects.intro: Give visitors an exciting view into the life of fur seals via an important collaboration.
projects.description:
Collaborated with renowned experience design shop Belle & Wissell to create an engaging, touch-screen interactive kiosk to be housed in the fur seals area of the Seattle Aquarium. Its purpose was to educate aquarium visitors, young and old, about the aquarium’s partnership (and grantee status) with NASA to study the endangered northern fur seal.

A custom touchscreen tablet remote control UI and PHP-based CMS were also built to allow interpreters to design presentations. These presentations could display photo and video slides as well as the kiosk UI on a big screen HD display.
projects.roles: Lead developer and technologist, automated stress testing, performance optimization over long durations, custom CMS development
projects.colophon: Flex 4, Flash 3D, Cairngorm, PHP, socket communication
